summary: Gumbo is a popular stew from Louisiana, made with a rich stock, meat or seafood, and vegetables like celery, peppers, and onions. It's often thickened with okra or fil√© powder, and cooked with a dark roux. The dish has a mix of African, French, German, Spanish, and Native American influences. It was first mentioned in 1802 and became more popular in the 1970s. Gumbo is usually served with rice and can also be made vegetarian with greens.
title: Gumbo
